tool_description: Catalog API is a service that ties your application to our catalog and order support department. With minimal integration, you can receive data feeds easily scoped to your demographics to provide exciting, up-to-date, and motivating catalogs. Your pa
name: CatalogAPI
title: CatalogAPI

api_list.name: Search Catalog
api_list.description: Searches the catalog based on the parameters passed.

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket_id of the catalog you are searching. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: search
required_parameters.description: Search the name, description and model of items.

required_parameters.name: max_rank
required_parameters.description: Do not return items with a rank higher than this value.

required_parameters.name: per_page
required_parameters.description: The number of items to return, per page. Can be from 1 to 50. Defaults to 10.

required_parameters.name: sort
required_parameters.description: The following sort values are supported:  points desc points asc rank asc score desc

optional_parameters.name: category_id
optional_parameters.description: Returns only items within this category_id.

optional_parameters.name: min_points
optional_parameters.description: Return only items that have a point value of at least this value.

optional_parameters.name: max_points
optional_parameters.description: Return only items that have a point value of no more than this value.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Place Order
api_list.description: This method places as order using the address and items in the cart. Once the order is placed, the cart is deleted.

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is an id from your system that identifies the user that the cart is for. It can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

optional_parameters.name: cart_version
optional_parameters.description: If cart_version is passed, this method will only succeed if the passed version matches the version of the current cart.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Catalog Breakdown
api_list.description: Breaks down the catalog into its categories

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket you want to receive the breakdown for. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

optional_parameters.name: is_flat
optional_parameters.description: By default, this method will return categories in a tree structure, with child categories contained within their parents.  If you set is_flat to "1", the categories will be returned as a flat list instead of a tree.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Remove Item

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is an id from your system that identifies the user that the cart is for. It can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

required_parameters.name: catalog_item_id
required_parameters.description: The catalog_item_id of the item. This item must already exist in the cart.

optional_parameters.name: option_id
optional_parameters.description: The option_id of the item, if the item has options. This option_id must match the option_id the item already in the cart.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Empty
api_list.description: Removes all items in the cart.

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is an id from your system that identifies the user that the cart is for. It can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: List Available Catalogs

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Order List
api_list.description: This method returns a list of order numbers (the Catalog API order numbers, not external_order_number) that match a given external_user_id.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is the external_user_id you passed when you placed the order. This method does not work with orders that do not have an external_user_id set.

required_parameters.name: per_page
required_parameters.description: The number of orders to return. Defaults to 10. Can be increased to a maximum of 50.

required_parameters.name: page
required_parameters.description: The page number of results to return when there are more than per_page results.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: View Item
api_list.description: Returns an image and description of the item

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: catalog_item_id
required_parameters.description: The catalog_item_id from the search_catalog method.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Unlock
api_list.description: Unlocks a cart that has been locked via the cart_validate method.

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is an id from your system that identifies the user that the cart is for. It can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

api_list.name: View
api_list.description: Returns the current address and items in the cart.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is an id from your system that identifies the user that the cart is for. It can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Validate
api_list.description: Validates the address and items in the cart. You should call this method just before placing an order to make sure that the order will not be rejected.

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is an id from your system that identifies the user that the cart is for. It can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

optional_parameters.name: locked
optional_parameters.description: Set this to "1" to lock the cart. (Defaults to "0") A locked cart cannot be modified, meaning that items cannot be added or removed, and the address cannot be changed. One use for this would be to lock the cart before processing a credit card transaction in your system. You would then be ensured that the item in the cart could not be changed while the transaction is processing. You can only call cart_view, cart_unlock, or cart_order_place on a locked cart.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Set Address
api_list.description: Adds a shipping address to the cart

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is an id from your system that identifies the user that the cart is for. It can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

required_parameters.name: state_province
required_parameters.description: For US states, this must be the two character abbreviation.

required_parameters.name: country
required_parameters.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the country the order will be shipped to.

required_parameters.name: phone_number
required_parameters.description: If set, this must be a valid phone number. This will only be used for order support or to contact the addressee to arrange a delivery time for any items that require a signature.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: If set, this must be a valid email address. We highly recommend that you provide an email address so that we can contact the addressee if there is a problem with the order.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Set Item Quantity
api_list.description: Adds items to the cart. The quantity passed to this call overrides the quantity of a duplicate item.

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is an id from your system that identifies the user that the cart is for. It can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

required_parameters.name: catalog_item_id
required_parameters.description: The catalog_item_id from the search_catalog method.

required_parameters.name: quantity
required_parameters.description: The number of items to add. If this item is already in the cart, this quantity will replace the current quantity.

optional_parameters.name: option_id
optional_parameters.description: The option_id from the search_catalog method. (This is required for items that have options.)

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Track Order
api_list.description: Tracks an order given an order number.

required_parameters.name: order_number
required_parameters.description: The order number you received after placing an order with order_place or cart_order_place.

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Add Item

required_parameters.name: quantity
required_parameters.description: The number of items to add. If this item is already in the cart, this quantity will be added to the current quantity.

required_parameters.name: socket_id
required_parameters.description: This is the socket that the item is in. You can find your available sockets by using the list_available_catalogs method.

required_parameters.name: external_user_id
required_parameters.description: This is an id from your system that identifies the user that the cart is for. It can contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores.

required_parameters.name: catalog_item_id
required_parameters.description: The catalog_item_id from the search_catalog method.

optional_parameters.name: option_id
optional_parameters.description: The option_id from the search_catalog method. (This is required for items that have options.)

Fault.faultstring: The uuid is required in the credentials.

api_list.name: Place Order without Cart
api_list.description: The order place method has a different endpoint than the other methods. You must POST your request to /v1/json/order_place/ if you are sending the order as json, or to /v1/xml/order_place/ if you are sending the order as xml.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://kkollstedt-catalogapi.p.rapidapi.com//order_place"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kkollstedt-catalogapi.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://kkollstedt-catalogapi.p.rapidapi.com//order_place"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kkollstedt-catalogapi.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
